definition: (said by departing guest) no need to see me out
old variant of 留[liu2]
to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve
old variant of 留[liu2]
surname Bu
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation

sentences.english: Ministers to liubu, want you to talk about retirement age problem.
sentences.chinese: 部长请留步，想请你谈谈退休年龄的问题。

sentences.english: There the rabble ended and the army began.
sentences.chinese: 那儿是交通停止，行人留步，军队开始的地方。

sentences.english: Don't trouble to come out, please.
We invite you to stay behind for lunch, enjoy the sweets and fellowship with one another.
sentences.chinese: 我们邀请你留步午餐交谊，享受点心。

sentences.english: He orders you to wait. He is coming up behind you.
sentences.chinese: 他要你们留步，他随后便到。

sentences.english: Here, visitors were halted to have papers examined.
sentences.chinese: 来人在这里留步以检查证件。

sentences.english: If he doesn't want you, nothing can make him stay.
sentences.chinese: 如果他不恋你，没有任何事物能让他留步。

definition: to wait a moment/do not go too soon
"please come in"
excuse me
to calm down/to quell one's anger
to come with a specific purpose in mind
Please do as you wish!/You are welcome to do whatever you like!/Please make yourself at home.
Stay a bit!/Wait a minute!/(to a departing guest) Take care!
brother (polite appellation for a friend one's age)
we are honored by your presence
to wait a moment
(literary) I trust you have been well since we last met
to salute/to greet
same as 慢慢吃[man4 man4 chi1]
please forgive me
to cup one's hands in obeisance or greeting/(fig.) submissive
to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/vexation/inconvenience
